item.title: Piles of black bin bags, 5th August
item.description:

item.title: Lawn mower and metal stands dumped on corner, 5th August
item.description:
Today Tues 5th Aug a lawn mower and two black metal stands were fly tipped on the corner of Roding Road and Colne Road. There have been multiple instances of fly tipping at this spot

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roding Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken opposite number 100 whitebeam avenue, 5th August
item.description:
The pavement is broken and is sticking up about 2 inches and when you tread on it it moves up and down

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intersection of Chichele Rd, Cricklewood Lane and Cricklewood Broadway, 5th August
item.description:
Yesterday, I made a complaint about some signs warning of future works in the area, which should have been removed a long time ago, because the works already took place three weeks ago, and have been completed. I will rewrite below exactly what I reported yesterday. But because You told me to take some pictures so you can see what it is, I copied from the internet two pictures with examples of those signs of abandoned works that I am talking about, because I can not take pictures on the spot, I am a bus driver and I just drive by there every day. That is why I sent two pictures at random, just so you can see what I am talking about. I hope it will be useful for you and that you contact the respective department that carried out the works to withdraw them from there. Yesterday's report is: Intersection of Chichele Road, Cricklewood Broadway and Cricklewood Lane Reported via mobile in the Obstruction - Skips category anonymously at 14:32, Monday Sent to Brent Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7977273. More than a month ago, yellow information panels were installed, as a result of some works that were to take place in the area. These signs were installed a month before the works began, and it has already been 3 weeks since the works were completed, and these yellow information panels have not disappeared from there, they are placed at every corner of the intersection on the sidewalks, blocking the safe movement of citizens. Someone needs to go and take them away urgently

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricklewood Broadway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging vegetation, 5th August
item.description:
Heavily overgrown bush hanging over fence from 1 Glanfield Rd onto pavement in Eden Park Ave. Other vegetation is also protruding through the length of their fence. Fence is broken in many places, and the broken panels are just left on the pavement causing an obstruction to pedestrians. On the corner of Eden Park Ave / Glanfield Rd there is a large section of broken fence panel left dangerously laying on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, Eden Park Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garden waste ( tree stump ) & headboards, 5th August
item.description:
Stuff dumped on street. This area often gets rubbish left behind. Can we get street cleaners to please report on this too ! Around Tree growth is overgrown which encourages this kind of littering. Can we please trim the overgrowth. All on this street!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Detritus on pavements and gutters, 5th August
item.description:
For some time the pavements and gutters on both sides of Park Road have been very dirty with a lot of detritus, including frequent piles of dog mess. When the street has been swept in the past, no parking restrictions have been imposed so the gutters have been impossible to clean.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Park Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fishing on bridge, 5th August
item.description:
Boys should not be fishing on bridge and there was a third hiding in the woods. As I was walking my dogs through the woods to the left of the bridge if facing north Cray, the young man in the back too ran past me towards the other one in the woods and came back with a tackle or bait box, I said to him you know your not supposed to be fishing don’t you he just said ‘yeah’ and carried on, I also said the same to the one in the woods but again he carried on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Five Arches, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unflush Pavement Repair - Trip Hazzard, 5th August
item.description:
There is a concrete pavement repair that has been done in such a way that the curb is no longer flush and it’s a clear trip hazard. The new concrete is about 2M long and about 10CM beyond the curb line.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, Bexley, London
